summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from June 5, 2020, in which Mark L. Epstein forwards a threatening message to the FBI. The forwarded message contains an extortion attempt, claiming knowledge of the killers of Mark's brother (presumably Jeffrey Epstein) and threatening the lives of Mark and his children if a ransom is not paid.

events.title: Extortion threat against Mark L. Epstein
events.description: An individual using the initials 'R O' sends a threatening email to Mark L. Epstein, claiming to have information about the killers of Jeffrey Epstein and demanding a ransom of $25,000 (2.5 bitcoin) to reveal it, while threatening the lives of Mark and his children.

events.title: Mark L. Epstein forwards threat to FBI
events.description: Mark L. Epstein forwards the extortion email he received to the FBI, seeking their attention and inquiring about the status of their investigation into individuals George Pompliano and Clara Yusko.

keyFacts: Mark L. Epstein, brother of Jeffrey Epstein, received a direct extortion threat in June 2020, claiming the sender had information about Jeffrey's killers.
The extortionist, 'R O', demanded $25,000 (2.5 bitcoin) and threatened to kill Mark or his children if he did not pay or if he went to the police.
Mark L. Epstein forwarded this threatening communication to the FBI, demonstrating he was actively seeking information and felt under threat.
In his email to the FBI, Mark specifically asks if they have looked for George Pompliano or Clara Yusko, indicating these individuals may be persons of interest in his view.
